p: In the case of E. coli strain ( Figure 11, left), PLA/Fe 3O 4@EG coatings determine the decrease of the bacterial population by ~2.5 folds, both after 24 h and 48 h of treatment. It can be clearly noticed that after 72 h of incubation in the presence of composite materials, the CFU/mL values are reduced by three times when compared to control values. Regarding the impact of PLA/Fe 3O 4@EG coatings on S. aureus biofilm development ( Figure 11, right), the inhibition level is more evident, since bacterial populations are reduced by at least 10 folds, regardless of the incubation time. These overall results evidence the effectiveness of PLA/Fe 3O 4@EG composite films as anti-biofilm surfaces.
